channel.title: Valve Women
channel.description:
As some of you may know, I’m a female. I play (more than any other) Valve games. In recent years Valve has included these strong female characters in their action games. Naturally, I like to play the female character except for in the Half Life series where it’s impossible. So, Alex in HL2 is the strong female personality in that game.
I’m just curious; out of Alex from Half Life 2, Zoey from Left 4 Dead, Rochelle from Left 4 Dead 2, and Chell from Portal, who do guys find most interesting? Not in a romantic way. But which female character do you like and why? This is not a contest……..I’m just genuinely curious. :slight_smile:

item.title: Valve Women
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I found Alyx to be a phenomenally well developed character. A big reason of why Episode One was so great is that she was by the player’s side almost the whole time and never felt out of place or artificial. She was there by Gordon’s side, she shot things accurately, etc. like a good AI should, but what really gets her to stand out is how her character develops over the course of the three segments of the series so far. Half Life 2’s focus is more on developing the world, the universe, what happened after the Combine hit. Alyx didn’t get very much screen time compared to her role in the Episodes, but she set a good tone for the universe. She was there to discover things with the player, point out stuff in the environment to further enhance the setting, and dish out snark in little tidbits. I got really invested in the character- I felt like I could relate to her as a person rather than as just another NPC in the game.

Zoey in L4D1 is a fun character- She’s a strong lead like Alyx but tends to enjoy herself more, with much funnier dialog. (“I call zombie bullshit!”)

Rochelle I haven’t logged enough hours in L4D2 to comment on her one way or the other, but I seem to recall Jessica Cannon (Sin Episodes: Emergence, not by Valve but on Source regardless) being a better player companion than her.

Chell is just the player’s avatar, like Gordon. So we can’t really comment on her character because she has no characterization.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve Women
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
jethrosoup:

I still don’t understand why you think that means he didn’t understand Half-Life’s story.

The reason being, because it doesn’t take much to realize how developed Alyx is. He must have missed that. Because if he understood the story, he would have understood what Half-Life is all about, and where Alyx fits in, and why she is so developed. He makes it seem as if he’s only watched youtube videos of it. I’ve actually played Left4Dead and Zoey was just another character played by another person. A playable NPC in a way. This whole discussion is deviating from the original poster’s intensions.

We’re arguing over Zoey and Alyx when the original poster expected people to list more characters from VALVe’s games. This isn’t a: “Who do you think is better, Zoey or Alyx and WHY?” thread.

Read full topic

Thanks, man.

item.title: Valve Women
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
^ lol, “Purging my stupidity.”

I just checked your Steam profile, and you don’t even own Left 4 Dead. You own Left 4 Dead 2, but have spent a third of your time in-game playing The Parish as Nick. Have you ever played a Left 4 Dead campaign or met Zoey? I don’t see how you’re qualified to judge her character when you’ve barely had any contact with her.

The fact of it is, the dynamic nature of Left 4 Dead and the background given in the comics mean we get a much broader look at Zoey than we do at Alyx, from who we see the same things, every playthrough. If you think Zoey has no depth, look harder.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve Women
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
av3nger:

Maxey, why haven’t you been banned? Sadly it seems the rules that are based around this forum, rather than condemn people for committing acts such as yours, ensure that those such as yourself get to roam free and unleash havoc on the forums. You have a following of jokers who reply to most of your posts. So the question is, do you just spend your entire existence in this ONE forum? Or have you been banned from places such as facepunch for your reign of fucking idiocy.

P.S. Troll is a redundant word in the context that you mainstream forum junkies use it. It must be so easy to follow everyone else rather than use your brain.

Maxey isn’t the leader. Sersoft is the troll leader.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve Women
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
jethrosoup:

What the…

How did you gather that he knows nothing about Half-Life from his post? He was saying you get to know the L4D ladies better than Alyx because you spend more time with them.

Only because of their snippets of dialogue. Alyx actually has some emotion and realism incorporated in her character. The only time that Left4Dead characters really have this, is in the 1-2 minute intro videos to the game. I’m just purging this guy’s stupidity.

Maxey, why haven’t you been banned? Sadly it seems the rules that are based around this forum, rather than condemn people for committing acts such as yours, ensure that those such as yourself get to roam free and unleash havoc on the forums. You have a following of jokers who reply to most of your posts. So the question is, do you just spend your entire existence in this ONE forum? Or have you been banned from places such as facepunch for your reign of fucking idiocy.

P.S. Troll is a redundant word in the context that you mainstream forum junkies use it. It must be so easy to follow everyone else rather than use your brain.

item.title: Valve Women
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
av3nger:

Hell no. Are you a damn moron??? Rochelle developed? YOU only know so much about Zoey because of her lines and the comics. Valve develops its story around Gordon Damn Freeman. You obviously didn’t understand Half-Life 1 or 2 at this point. It’s about Freeman, Barney, Kleiner for the most part, the three Stooges. G-Man is really what the series revolves around as well, and the combine. Mainly because they are tied to the semi-whole theme of the game, teleportation and physics. And a sub category of physics for Half-Life, is puzzles.

Nothing in this post makes any sense to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve Women
item.dc:creator: freundin88
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

I think the best thing about Valve’s character designs is they don’t over do it.

A lot of other games (and even other mediums such as movies) have women who they just make too much a deal of. The designs scream “HEY LOOK AT ME I’M A STRONG WOMAN, PLEASE WOMEN ADMIRE MY CHARACTER DESIGN” (or you could just say they tried to hard).

Valve treats there women like they do the male characters. It’s a women, who happens to be strong and competent big deal.

Exactly! Like in the Alien movies. Ripley was the ultimate woman. All the men were either evil or total incompetents. OMG I hate that!

Read full topic

item.description:
Hurray! Closure!

Read full topic

item.title: Valve Women
item.dc:creator: freundin88
item.description:
danielsangeo:

She had a really minor role but she really stood out in my book. She’s in Route Kanal and tells Gordon to keep going and, “I’m gonna stay here in case any others come through. Gotta keep the railway alive.”

For a bit part, this woman, Mary, stands out in my mind, so I’m going to be different from the Alyxes, Chells, Rochelles and Zoes here and say Mary.

Yeah, you know, you’re right. As a matter of fact I think she says, “keep going FRIEND”.

Read full topic

item.title: Valve Women
item.dc:creator: JohnWorfin
item.description:
gugamilare:

I felt sorry for her, because I realize there was no way she could survive there alone and unarmed with lots of combine around her. I remember waiting a little bit there almost telling her to follow me.

If you wait long enough you get to see her death by CP gangbang
